**Filing begins July 28 for special election and general election**
The filing period for four school board seats up for election this fall begins July 28 and runs through August 11. Dear GG stands for "Grandpa" or "Grandma". We are asking for kids in Brooklyn Park to make a card, color a picture or write a short letter to a local senior citizen and address it to “Dear GG”.

This project will give kids a creative way to bring joy to a senior during a time when they are unable to receive visits from family or friends due to COVID-19. We believe this is also a way for kids to have a fun project that will benefit someone else in their community during these unusual times.

The cards or letters should be signed with the child’s first name only and can be dropped at the Brooklyn Park Police Department during the days/times listed below. The police department will deliver the cards and letters to seniors living in Brooklyn Park.

Sunday, August 2 from 11:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m.

Christian Taylor may have won back-to-back Olympic titles 🥇🥇 in the triple jump, but he also has a heart of gold.

The track and field star, who has been mentoring students in Jennifer Phillips' second grade class at Fair Oaks Elementary through the Classroom Champions program this year, met with students virtually this morning for a video update. While he's still training from home, Taylor said his life looks a lot different these days but that he's staying positive and looking forward to competing at the postponed Olympic Games in Tokyo next summer.

During the Google Meet, students had a chance to ask Taylor several questions, learning about his favorite food (salads), future pets he hopes to have (two dogs), and how he's been keeping busy during COVID-19 (lots of reading!).

Distance learning has been an adjustment for students throughout Osseo Area Schools, but Taylor had high praise for Phillips' scholars. "I am so proud of how well you all have adapted," he told students. "It's phenomenal!"
